In my personal understanding, the evaluation dimensions of online games are completely different from those of single-player games.
The game mode of online games is strictly influenced by the network hardware environment and the direct impact of public configuration.
Therefore, online games are often full of compromises of various eras.
The evaluation of online games can only be compared horizontally based on the time point at that time.
For example, Stone Age and Magic Baby, although there is overlapping operating time, are completely two generations of games, whether from the perspective of mechanism design or developer turnover.
So although Magic Baby's game quality itself crushes Stone Age in all dimensions, in my understanding, Stone Age is better than Magic Baby.
Similarly, Blade & Soul, the MMO that pioneered the 'no' lock mode, although its number of monsters on the same screen and synchronization rate are crushed by World of Warcraft, is also a great game.

Both are 'mass stand-up', EVE's completely free market and more attribute dimensions of battleships are much stronger than the Killing Dragon Blade of Hot-Blooded Legend, which instantly kills everything.

1. MapleStory: When I was in 4th grade, my brother dragged me to a computer cafe for the night. I wasn't even as tall as the computer.
2. World of Warcraft: I'm still playing it.
3. Lost Ark: I just started playing it and got to the female BOSS, the old bull is next.
I forgot what it's called. It's a good game ruined by the planners.
4. LOL: Occasionally play a round with friends. It's so tiring to play.
5. DNF: Go up once a year to claim a set of Sky costumes. I didn't have money when I was a kid, and I was extremely envious.
Then uninstall.
6. Crazy Racing: I personally think it's more fun than Kart Rider, haha.
7. Conquer Online: I saved up to buy a Da Fei (expensive in-game item).

8. CF: Playing day and night all night. The happiest time was when I was farming fatigue in the first half of the night, playing shooting games in the middle, and watching xxx in the second half of the night.
9. Jian Wang 3? I played it with classmates for a while in college. My evaluation is that it's not as good as WoW.
10. FF14? I played it for a while when it was released. It was very novel.
But I don't like the art style.
11. Blade & Soul: It's fun!
I will never forget the joy of logging into Rainbow Island and seeing that colorful new world.
